2. Private equity funds. As the name suggests, private equity funds invest in the equity
of companies that are not publicly traded or in the equity of publicly traded firms
that the fund intends to take private. Leveraged buyout (LBO) funds use borrowed
money to purchase equity in established companies and comprise the majority of
private equity investment funds. A much smaller portion of these funds, venture
capital funds, invest in or finance young unproven companies at various stages
early in their existence. For our purposes here we will also consider investing in the
securities of financially distressed companies to be private equity, although hedge
funds may hold these also.
